Detailed Description

This class allows to make a Bayesian estimation of a one-dimensional Normal distribution with fixed standard deviation sigma0 when the prior distribution over the Normal mean is itself a Normal distribution.

The conjugacy property of the Normal distribution with respect to itself ensures that the posterior distribution over the Normal mean is itself a Normal distribution whose parameters can be computed analytically.

A Normal distribution with learned parameter mu (called mean) and fixed parameter sigma0 (called standard deviation, square root of the variance sigma0^2) has the following probability density function:

See Also
plBayesLearnObject plNormal

plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation::plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation ( plSymbol const &  variable,
plFloat  init_mu,
plFloat  init_sigma,
plFloat  sigma0 
)

Creates a learnable normal distribution with fixed standard deviation, where the prior over the Normal mean follows a Normal distribution.

Parameters
[in]variablethe variable of the learnt distribution.
[in]init_muInitial value of the mu parameter of the Normal distribution over the learned Normal mean.
[in]init_sigmaInitial value of the sigma parameter of the Normal distribution over the learned Normal mean. It must be strictly positive.
[in]sigma0Fixed standard deviation of the learned Normal distribution.
plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation::plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation ( plSymbol const &  variable)
explicitprotected

Creates a learnable Normal distribution, where the prior over the mean follows a Normal distribution.

mu and sigma are initialized arbitrarily to 0 and 1. This constructor is here only for use with plCndLearnObject<>, it should be used with care as the arbitrary initialization of mu and sigma generally makes no sense.

virtual plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation::~plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation ( )
inlinevirtual

Destructor.

plDistribution plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation::get_aposteriori_distribution ( plVariablesConjunction const &  mu) const
virtual

Returns the Normal distribution corresponding to the posterior distribution over the Normal mean mu knowing all learned data.

Parameters
[in]muVariable that corresponds to the Normal mean, on which to build the posterior distribution. Must be a variable with a real type.

Implements plBayesLearnObject.

unsigned int plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation::get_n_parameters ( ) const
inlinevirtual

Returns the ACTUAL number of parameters.

It could be different from the number of parameters returned by get_parameters.

For example, the actual number of parameters of a N dimensional normal distribution is N + N*(N+1)/2 because the covariance matrix is symmetric.

Implements plLearnObject.

void plBayesLearn1dNormalWithKnownStandardDeviation::get_parameters ( plValues &  params) const
inlinevirtual

Returns all learnt parameters of the object (parameters passed to the distribution constructors when calling 'get_distribution').

This virtual method has to be implemented in all derived classes.
